content:
Phone Swap ERD

User

ID: Unique identifier for each user

Phone

ID: Unique identifier for each phone

Brand: The brand of the phone (e.g. Apple, Samsung)

Model: The model of the phone (e.g. iPhone 13, Galaxy S22)

Storage: The storage capacity of the phone (e.g. 64GB, 128GB)

Price: The price of the phone

User - Phone Swap Request

  • User requests a phone swap with another user.
  • Phone is the target of the swap request.

Phone Swap Request

ID: Unique identifier for each phone swap request

User ID: The ID of the user making the swap request.

Requested Phone: The phone being requested in the swap.

Offered Phone: The phone being offered in the swap.

Status: The status of the swap request (e.g. pending, approved, rejected).

Confirmation Message

The phone swap request has been successfully submitted.

Phone Swap ERD

User

ID: Unique identifier for each user

Phone

ID: Unique identifier for each phone

Brand: The brand of the phone (e.g. Apple, Samsung)

Model: The model of the phone (e.g. iPhone 13, Galaxy S22)

Storage: The storage capacity of the phone (e.g. 64GB, 128GB)

Price: The price of the phone

User - Phone Swap Request

  • User requests a phone swap with another user.
  • Phone is the target of the swap request.

Phone Swap Request

User ID: The ID of the user making the swap request.

Requested Phone: The phone being requested in the swap.

Offered Phone: The phone being offered in the swap.

Status: The status of the swap request (e.g. pending, approved, rejected).

Confirmation Message

The phone swap request has been successfully submitted.

content:
Phone Swap Request Feature ERD

User DTO

Represents a user in the system.

  • id: Unique identifier for the user.
  • phones: A list of phones owned by the user.

Phone DTO

Represents a phone in the system.

  • id: Unique identifier for the phone.
  • brand: The brand of the phone.
  • model: The model of the phone.
  • storage: The storage capacity of the phone.
  • price: The price of the phone.

Phone Swap Request

A request to swap a user's current phone for another one available in the system.

  • user_id: The ID of the user making the request.
  • requested_phone: The phone being requested by the user.
  • offered_phone: The phone being offered by the user in exchange for the requested one.
  • status: The status of the request (e.g., pending, approved, rejected).

Phone Swap Request Status

The possible statuses for a phone swap request.

  • pending: The request is pending review by the system administrator.
  • approved: The request has been approved, and the user will receive the requested phone.
  • rejected: The request has been rejected, and the user cannot swap phones at this time.
